Entries.default: "Real pretty place. It'd be a shame to die here."
"For what would they run from Ngati's chosen? Something is wrong here, captain."
"I might have made a few enemies here. Tread lightly."
"Well, darn, I didn't think we looked that scary."
"I've sworn one too many times on Ondra's salty bosom to go trudging through these waters."
"Usually only children and animals flee me like that."
"Water looks a little deep for these short legs. Maybe one of you strapping ladies could give me a lift?"
"This script... it is written Seki. But how?"
"'I am Wingauro o WatÅ«ri the first, dragon of Deadfire, the great king of Ukaizo, the king of kings.'"
"Some of these glyphs are familiar. I believe those on the left are Engwithan."
"Ekera, you're right. And those words over there are Huana symbols. A most unusual pairing."
"'By God's - ah, Ondra's - will, these lands conform to my decrees.'"
"Did my people come to this place? This Ukaizo?"
"But the storms... It would be many, many years in the past."
"Can you be more precise? The fall of Ukaizo has been myth longer than it's been history."
"How many is 'many' by your math, friend Rekke? The tribes seldom agree on the timeline of Ukaizo's fall."
"Ten hundreds. More."
"What does it say?"
"Stop staring at the floor, we have work to do."
[Say nothing.]
"It is an old style. One moment." He crouches down to get a better look.
"This is very strange."
"Fine... gela kasiniw." Glowering at you, he turns away.
Rekke runs his hand over the glyphs, a look of wonder on his face. After a long, silent moment, he stands and motions for the party to move on.
